Core

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Core.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Board
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Graphical User Interface that converts a given matrix into a graphical board. This class also provides methods to manipulate that board and set how the graphics are displayed. This interface can work with either colors, text, or defined image sprites. Other options as displaying backgrounds, overdraws, or changing the size of individual cells are provided.
    Version:
    2.15
    Author:
    Marc Albareda
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public Board()

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(int[][] a,
                 char c)
        Public draw method. This is the method called by the user and draws the matrix received
        Parameters:
        a - int matrix to be drawn. It will draw as a board using the options received
        c - type of the matrix to be drawn. 'c' will mean color, 't' text and 's' sprite

      • draw

        public void draw(int[][] a,
                 char c,
                 int x1,
                 int y1,
                 int x2,
                 int y2)
        Public draw method. This is the method called by the user and draws the matrix received
        Parameters:
        a - int matrix to be drawn. It will draw as a board using the options received
        c - type of the matrix to be drawn. 'c' will mean color, 't' text and 's' sprite
        x1 - y1 x2 y2 the four corners of the submatrix to be actually drawn

      • draw

        public void draw(int[][] a,
                 int x1,
                 int y1,
                 int x2,
                 int y2)
        Public draw method. This is the method called by the user and draws the matrix received
        Parameters:
        a - int matrix to be drawn. It will draw as a board using the options received. It will be assumed as a sprite matrix
        x1 - y1 x2 y2 the four corners of the submatrix to be actually drawn

      • draw

        public void draw(int[][] a)
        Public draw method. This is the method called by the user and draws the matrix received
        Parameters:
        a - int matrix to be drawn. It will draw as a board using the options received. It will be assumed as a sprite matrix

      • draw

        public void draw(int[][][] a,
                 char[] b)
        Public draw method. This is the method called by the user and draws the matrixes received in a layered way, with the first being the bottom one and the last being the top one
        Parameters:
        a - array of int matrixes to be drawn. It will draw as a board using the options received.
        b - array of chars, one for each layer, showing the type of the matrix to be drawn. 'c' will mean color, 't' text and 's' sprite

      • draw

        public void draw(int[][][] a)
        Public draw method. This is the method called by the user and draws the matrixes received in a layered way, with the first being the bottom one and the last being the top one
        Parameters:
        a - array of int matrixes to be drawn. It will draw as a board using the options received. It will be assumed as every matrix to be made of sprites
        b - array of chars, one for each layer, showing the type of the matrix to be drawn. 'c' will mean color, 't' text and 's' sprite

      • draw

        public void draw(int[][][] a,
                 char[] b,
                 int x1,
                 int y1,
                 int x2,
                 int y2)
        Public draw method. This is the method called by the user and draws the matrixes received in a layered way, with the first being the bottom one and the last being the top one. Assumes every layer is of the same size (otherwise zoom would make no sense)
        Parameters:
        a - array of int matrixes to be drawn. It will draw as a board using the options received. It will be assumed as every matrix to be made of sprites
        b - array of chars, one for each layer, showing the type of the matrix to be drawn. 'c' will mean color, 't' text and 's' sprite
        x1 - y1 x2 y2 the four corners of the submatrix to be actually drawn

      • draw

        public void draw(int[][][] a,
                 int x1,
                 int y1,
                 int x2,
                 int y2)
        Public draw method. This is the method called by the user and draws the matrixes received in a layered way, with the first being the bottom one and the last being the top one
        Parameters:
        a - array of int matrixes to be drawn. It will draw as a board using the options received. It will be assumed as every matrix to be made of sprites
        x1 - y1 x2 y2 the four corners of the submatrix to be actually drawn
